reviews.review_msg: If you consider showing up for a class you paid for and typing 250 words a week for free participation marks difficult, you should probably drop out. Leith is one of those rare professors that actually cares about her students. She provides very detailed feedback on essays/exams, and tries her best to make the class fun for everybody.

Professor Davis expects literally everybody in this mandatory survey course to care for Romantic Lit like it was their own child. She expects every student to not only attend mandatory morning tutorials, but also produce discussion comments--"substantial reflections rather than subjective responses"--once a week. Keeners: go for it. Else, beware.

Very passionate about the material, provides lots of canvas help including 'translations' for more difficult texts. Takes class suggestions well and is always looking to improve student's experience. The texts assigned were mostly interesting, save a few that were provided mostly for historical context (unless that's your thing).
Best English prof I've had at SFU. Clear cut, easy midterm and final, enjoyable material and nice to listen to!
No Comments

Professor Everton was great! Lectures were very helpful as he would carefully analyze and break down the assigned readings. Take good notes on his interpretations of the readings, as they will be a big help for papers. The final exam was long, but if you've paid attention in class & took detailed notes, you will do well.
Hilarious
Uhh... I wanted to record his voice so I could listen to it again and again and again....He's a great prof and I learned so much.

Best prof I've ever had. I hope I can take the remainder of my english classes with him. He's gorgeous, but also such an amazing lecturer. He's engaging and makes the material really stick. I looked forward to going to class every time. Came out of class wanting to do all my readings for next week. He and the TAs are really hard markers though.

Awesome teacher! Lectures are always interesting, especially due to his passion for the material. He's really good at saying "you NEED to know this" and saying it a couple times so you can write it down. Always willing to chat and help. Notes on the overhead are limited so you need to take good ones. I highly recommend taking a class with him!

He is honestly the best professor ever! I look forward to going to class because he makes it so enjoyable. His was the only midterm I have EVER come out of feeling confident, and not because it was easy or because I studied, but because he lectures in a way that makes the material STICK. Readings are also well-chosen and interesting.

Seemed entirely pompous. I get that he's cares more about teaching than about students grades but seriously? He spent half the time jumping on his desk. I felt like he was auditioning for the role of "spirited teacher" in a movie Self-patronizing. The class was more about HIM than the topics we covered. Expect to do a LOT of work with little reward

I echo every positive comment that has been previously stated. He IS the best in the English department. I've learned more from him than from any other professor. However, I received a C, so if you're looking to get an A in a more laid-back environment, I suggest looking elsewhere for a course.

Best English class so far. I didn't think I'd like American lit but he made it AWESOME! He marks fair-you can get a good grade in his class but you have to think critically and outside the box. Very willing to help. If you can take a class with him-you won't regret it!

You learn a lot from Mike, but if you take this class, don't expect to get an A. I've gotten the worst marks EVER for an English class because him and his TAs are hard markers. It really depends on what you value when you take an English course - your grade, or how much you learn. IT IS an engaging class and I enjoyed it for the most part.

The BEST prof I've had: lives up to what we all dream uni is like. Singlehandedly saved my semester from being total boredom and hell. Very eloquent,clear,focused,passionate...it's contagious. Cares about his students. Cares about learning. I leave his classes with a buzz,wanting to write.

Fabulous professor - his lectures were really interesting and interactive, and the reading list he compiled as a representative cross-section of 19th century American Lit was excellent. Gives a long list of possible essay topics and also lets you pick your own. Both essays are weighted equally, so there is no "final" paper. He's also really hot.

I great teacher who really know his stuff and loves teaching.  He's a lot of fun, but he expects you to do your reading and know your stuff.  A bit of a hard marker on papers, but if you take the time to write them well, then you can geta good grade.

Dr. Everton is an awesome lecturer and I look forward to taking more courses with him. He seems very comfortable in front of the class and manages to keep everyone engaged and (as a first for me) interested. He's also compiled an exceptional reading list. Gives Americans a good name.

Dr. Levy is amazing! If you're passionate about literature, take her class. She's really good with online learning and she keeps her students engaged. She makes her students read and work a lot, but I felt that I had improved a lot as an English student throughout her course. Her deadlines were very reasonable. She's passionate about education!

I had Michelle for ENGL 206 two years ago. She was a bit boring and I did not like the stuffed overhead slides..I was paying more attention to writing them down instead of her speaking. She also seems a little proud, which affects the way she imposes her interpretations. She is my prof for ENGL 322 in Spring 2010. Let's hope something changes.
No Comments

I don't feel like I'm learning anything. Lectures are pretty useless, and very little time is spent actually discussing literature. Worst English prof I've had yet. Made me reconsider my major in English.

Grow up 1st years! This is a prof who knows her stuff-learn from her! She is knowledgeable and will help you improve yourself! She is perhaps "eccentric" from a certain perspective, but she is engaged in what she teaches.  U paid 4 classes-so attend them! Learn something from 1 of the better profs u will ever have!

Very knowledgeable about the subject, seems genuinely intersted in what she teaches. Interesting and engaging lectures, encourages discussion. Assignments are a bit tough, though. Friendly and approachable. I would definetly take another class with Nicky.
Interesting course, good prof.  A lot of discussion that often doesnt include u. Webct, lots of writing, but creative formats.  Very encouraging and pleasant prof.  Content is female empowered.

Wonderful prof. Quirky and fun. A genuine person who wants everyone to do well in her class. It's nice to be able to pick your own assignments and when they're due. I would take her class again in the future.
Very good - made class interesting and it rocks being able to pick your own assignments and marking scheme (which you can change right up til the final)

I like her reading list. Dr Colligan's assignments were exciting to do, but they needed to be completed by software which was sometimes tricky. But the technology increased my interests to do homework and explore knowledge. The lectures were relaxed. I really enjoyed taking Dr Colligan's class.

Awesome prof who makes everything interesting!  She's very helpful and very enthusiastic about the material!  Let us read something other than Wordsworth and Dickens, but still included these classic writers!  I actually ENJOYED going to the class!  Highly recommended!
No Comments
The class is not what I expected.  I would have rather had a class that covered more Romantic Literature as opposed to going against the grain.

A thorough survey course of Victorian literature of every variety.  I was very surprised to learn that we still seem to be in the Victorian age, not just because our sexual politics are so colonial and backward.  Very interesting; very engaging.

I can see personality conflicts happening often with Ogden.  Personally I found him an excellent prof and TA.  I think he will accept a challenging perspective, but expects a compelling and well researched argument.  Either that or I'm just one of the many blind sighted by classroom stage antics, which I'm OK with. (Looks good in a dress)
extremely arrogant and unwilling to help you unless you prove you've got a very high level of knowledge in the course material. lectures and exams were both scattered and vague.
Seemed like a nice guy, but a pretty hard marker, and his lectures were a bit unorganized.

Carolyn is very passionate and enthusiastic and you can tell she throughly enjoys teaching. Lectures sometimes feel a bit rushed because there is so much to cover in so little time. She will post the powerpoint lectures but make sure you don't miss lecture because she goes into a lot more detail than what is posted on her slides.
Probably my favourite professor at SFU so far

The course material she chose was generally awful and her mid term and final were way too long...however...Dr Lesjak is a lovely person who has a great attitude and seems to know what she's talking about. She's a bit more political than most other English profs, so keep that in mind.

Kandice is a gem of a prof. Her material is interesting, yet pleasantly challenging. Shes incredibly easy to talk to and understanding. Even her assignments, although graded rather hard, are open ended and leave a lot of room for what intrigues you personally. I could not recommend a prof more highly. If you have the chance, take a course with her

Kandice is a really tough grader but she managed to make boring topics interesting. Lectures were engaging and you can tell how passionate she is about it. She also clearly cares about her students. Only issue is that she chose a lot of potentially triggering contenti.e. slave narratives and assault and she did not provide adequate warnings.

This was my second course with Kandice and hopefully not my last. She is funny and engaging and really takes time to get to know everyone. If you get the chance to be in her tutorial take it! Grading is a bit tough but the criteria and assignments are clear and fair. Attendance is mandatory but she is very understanding if you miss class.

Kandice is the best English prof I have ever had. She is super inspiring, knowledgeable and kind. I had her as a TA as well and she gave me really helpful feedback and made me a stronger writer. She truly cares about her students and I highly recommend taking a course with her!
Dry lectures and no laptops. Be prepared to take notes for two hours and don't be like me because my hand gets tired after an hour hahahaha, show up to class with coffee.

Professor Sharren was such an eloquent and well organized prof! She made coming to class a pleasure and is always available to help between lectures and on email. I would love to take a class with her again!

Margaret is clearly knowledgeable about and interested in the subject matter, and is always open to questions and discussion in class. Her lectures were not always enthralling but her slides did highlight the information you needed to know for the final exam. Not a hard class in terms of what you are learning but the marking was usually harsh.
